Abstract: Europe is a continent located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere. It is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, the Mediterranean Sea to the south, and Asia to the east. Europe shares the landmass of Eurasia with Asia, and of Afro-Eurasia with both Africa and Asia. Europe is commonly considered to be separated from Asia by the watershed of the Ural Mountains, the Ural River, the Caspian Sea, the Greater Caucasus, the Black Sea, and the waterway of the Bosporus Strait. Europe covers approx. 10,186,000 square kilometres, or 2% of Earth's surface, making it the second-smallest continent. Politically, Europe is divided into about fifty sovereign states, of which Russia is the largest and most populous, spanning 39% of the continent and comprising 15% of its population. Europe had a total population of about 745 million in 2021; the third-largest after Asia and Africa.
AbstractText: Europe is a continent located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere. It is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, the Mediterranean Sea to the south, and Asia to the east. Europe shares the landmass of Eurasia with Asia, and of Afro-Eurasia with both Africa and Asia. Europe is commonly considered to be separated from Asia by the watershed of the Ural Mountains, the Ural River, the Caspian Sea, the Greater Caucasus, the Black Sea, and the waterway of the Bosporus Strait. Europe covers approx. 10,186,000 square kilometres, or 2% of Earth's surface, making it the second-smallest continent. Politically, Europe is divided into about fifty sovereign states, of which Russia is the largest and most populous, spanning 39% of the continent and comprising 15% of its population. Europe had a total population of about 745 million in 2021; the third-largest after Asia and Africa.
Heading: Europe

content.label: Languages
content.value: Most common: Russian, German, French, Italian, English, Spanish, Polish, Ukrainian, Romanian, Dutch

content.label: Largest cities
content.value: Largest urban areas:Moscow, Istanbul [b], Paris, London, Madrid, Essen-Düsseldorf, Saint Petersburg, Milan, Barcelona, Berlin

RelatedTopics.Result: Early modern Europe - Early modern Europe, also referred to as the post-medieval period, is the period of European history between the end of the Middle Ages and the beginning of the Industrial Revolution, roughly the mid 15th century to the late 18th century.
RelatedTopics.Text: Early modern Europe - Early modern Europe, also referred to as the post-medieval period, is the period of European history between the end of the Middle Ages and the beginning of the Industrial Revolution, roughly the mid 15th century to the late 18th century.

RelatedTopics.Result: Eurodistrict - A eurodistrict is a European administrative entity that contains urban agglomerations which lie across the border between two or more states.
RelatedTopics.Text: Eurodistrict - A eurodistrict is a European administrative entity that contains urban agglomerations which lie across the border between two or more states.

RelatedTopics.Result: European Games - The European Games is a continental multi-sport event in the Olympic tradition contested by athletes from countries served by national Olympic committees within the European Olympic Committees, the regional association for such committees.
RelatedTopics.Text: European Games - The European Games is a continental multi-sport event in the Olympic tradition contested by athletes from countries served by national Olympic committees within the European Olympic Committees, the regional association for such committees.

RelatedTopics.Result: Euroregion - In European politics, the term Euroregion usually refers to a transnational co-operation structure between two contiguous territories located in different European countries. Euroregions represent a specific type of cross-border region.
